org.castor.spring.orm.support

Class CastorDaoSupport

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.dao.support.DaoSupport
      • org.castor.spring.orm.support.CastorDaoSupport
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean

    public abstract class CastorDaoSupport
extends org.springframework.dao.support.DaoSupport
    Convenient super class for Castor JDO data access objects.

    Requires a JDOManager to be set, providing a CastorTemplate based on it to subclasses. Can alternatively be initialized directly with a CastorTemplate, to reuse the latter's settings such as the JDOManager, CastorDialect, flush mode, etc.

    This base class is mainly intended for CastorTemplate usage but can also be used when working with JDOManagerUtils directly, for example in combination with CastorInterceptor-managed Databases. Convenience getDatabase and releaseDatabase methods are provided for that usage style.

    This class will create its own CastorTemplate if only a JDOManager is passed in. The "allowCreate" flag on that CastorTemplate will be "true" by default. A custom CastorTemplate instance can be used through overriding createCastorTemplate.

    Since:
    1.0-SNAPSHOT
    Author:
    Werner Guttmann
    See Also:
    setJDOManager(org.exolab.castor.jdo.JDOManager), #setCastorTemplate, createCastorTemplate(org.exolab.castor.jdo.JDOManager), getDatabase(), releaseDatabase(org.exolab.castor.jdo.Database), org.springframework.orm.cator.CastorTemplate, CastorInterceptor

    • Method Detail

      • setJDOManager

        public final void setJDOManager(org.exolab.castor.jdo.JDOManager jdoManager)
        Set the Castor JDOManager to be used by this DAO. Will automatically create a CastorTemplate for the given JDOManager.
        See Also:
        createCastorTemplate(org.exolab.castor.jdo.JDOManager), #setCastorTemplate

      • createCastorTemplate

        protected CastorTemplate createCastorTemplate(org.exolab.castor.jdo.JDOManager jdoManager)
        Create a CastorTemplate for the given JDOManager. Only invoked if populating the DAO with a JDOManager reference!

        Can be overridden in subclasses to provide a CastorTemplate instance with different configuration, or a custom CastorTemplate subclass.

        Parameters:
        jdoManager - the Castor JDOManager to create a CastorTemplate for
        Returns:
        the new CstorTemplate instance
        See Also:
        setJDOManager(org.exolab.castor.jdo.JDOManager)

      • getJDOManager

        public final org.exolab.castor.jdo.JDOManager getJDOManager()
        Return the Castor JDOManager used by this DAO.

      • setJdoTemplate

        public final void setJdoTemplate(CastorTemplate castorTemplate)
        Set the CastorTemplate for this DAO explicitly, as an alternative to specifying a JDOManager.
        See Also:
        setJDOManager(org.exolab.castor.jdo.JDOManager)

      • getCastorTemplate

        public final CastorTemplate getCastorTemplate()
        Return the CastorTemplate for this DAO, pre-initialized with the JDOManager or set explicitly.

        protected final void checkDaoConfig()

      • getDatabase

        protected final org.exolab.castor.jdo.Database getDatabase()
        Get a Castor Database, either from the current transaction or a new one. The latter is only allowed if the "allowCreate" setting of this bean's CastorTemplate is true.
        Returns:
        the Castor JDO Database
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessResourceFailureException - if the Database couldn't be created
        IllegalStateException - if no thread-bound Database found and allowCreate false
        See Also:
        JDOManagerUtils.getDatabase(org.exolab.castor.jdo.JDOManager, boolean)

      • getDatabase

        protected final org.exolab.castor.jdo.Database getDatabase(boolean allowCreate)
                                                    throws org.springframework.dao.DataAccessResourceFailureException,
                                                           IllegalStateException
        Get a Castor JDO Database, either from the current transaction or a new one. The latter is only allowed if "allowCreate" is true.
        Parameters:
        allowCreate - if a non-transactional Database should be created when no transactional Database can be found for the current thread
        Returns:
        the Castor JDO Database
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessResourceFailureException - if the Database couldn't be created
        IllegalStateException - if no thread-bound Database found and allowCreate false
        See Also:
        JDOManagerUtils.getDatabase(org.exolab.castor.jdo.JDOManager, boolean)

      • convertJdoAccessException

        protected final org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException convertJdoAccessException(org.exolab.castor.jdo.PersistenceException ex)
        Convert the given PersistenceException to an appropriate exception from the org.springframework.dao hierarchy.

        Delegates to the translateException method of this DAO's default dialect.

        Parameters:
        ex - PersistenceException that occured
        Returns:
        the corresponding DataAccessException instance
        See Also:
        #setCastorTemplate, CastorDialect.translateException(PersistenceException)

      • releaseDatabase

        protected final void releaseDatabase(org.exolab.castor.jdo.Database database)
        Close the given Castor JDO org.castor.jdo.conf.Database, created via this DAO's JDOManager, if it isn't bound to the thread.
        Parameters:
        database - Database to close
        See Also:
        org.castor.spring.orm.JDOManagerUtils#releaseDatabase
